content.p: Ratch stands for Ruby-based batch files. Specifically Ratch is a Domain Specific Language for writing batch scripts in Ruby. ... Ratch is being used as the bases of Reap services, making it much more convient to build project scripts than plain Ruby provides.
Use Ratch as you would Ruby when writing a script. Instead of the ruby shebang line use a ratch shebang line.
For details on all that Ratch provides, see the RDocs.
Ratch is still Beta sofware. The DSL will continue to evolve for the foreseeable future.
To install from source you will need Ruby Setup.
content.pre: $ tar -xzf ratch-x.y.z.tar.gz $ cd ratch-x.y.z $ setup.rb all
content.p: Microsoft Windows users, you'll have to use '@ruby task/setup@' instead.
